Either specifically for Java or just for WPILib in general. What are some helpful VSCode extensions your team uses? Personally I use Error Lens (an actual gift from the gods), and colorful comments. What about you?

Incredibly In Your Face - Visual Studio Marketplace

Extension for Visual Studio Code - In Your Face, shows you Incredible 'Uncanny Faces' that correlate to the number of errors in your code!

My fav is Git Lens, but I can make a list of my top 5

  • Git Lens
  • Git Lens
  • Git Lens
  • Git Lens
  • Git Lens

Out of those 5 i recommend Git Lens the most

While you are here, may I introduce you to our lord and savior Git Lens?

I really like Spotless, itâ€™s a code formatter that weâ€™ve used and it helps keep our code cleaner.

Spotless isnâ€™t really a VSCode extention, its a gradle plugin, but its available there too

marketplace.visualstudio.com

Spotless Gradle - Visual Studio Marketplace

Extension for Visual Studio Code - Format your source files using Spotless via Gradle

Our programmers usually just add it on as a gradle plugin

github.com

spotless/plugin-gradle at main Â· diffplug/spotless

Keep your code spotless. Contribute to diffplug/spotless development by creating an account on GitHub.

My standard set of VSCode extensions:

  • GitHub Pull Requests â€“ for managing GH PRs & Issues
  • GitLens
  • Material Icon Theme â€“ Iâ€™ve looked at lots of icon themes, this oneâ€™s my favorite
  • For Java - Red Hat Language Support for Java, Microsoft Debugger for Java are all Iâ€™ve needed
  • Thereâ€™s extensions for lots of different tools, and I highly recommend you use profiles to keep your extensions separate (so, for example, the Svelte and ESLint extensions arenâ€™t active when working on robot code and the Python extensions arenâ€™t active when Iâ€™m typing up my homework in LaTeX)
